p:
The durability of catalytic performance is an important factor for practical applications. The electrochemical stability of CMO_L was then tested by potential cycling (load cycle) between 0.6 and 1.0 V in N 2-saturated 0.1 M KOH solution. Aged CMO_L showed a negative potential shift for the ORR current, as shown in Figure S7a, which indicated that CMO_L deteriorates when subjected to a load cycle test. This deterioration is attributable to the repeated redox reaction on the CMO_L surface. Figure S7b shows CV curves after load cycles. CMO_L initially exhibited oxidation and reduction peaks at 0.8 and 0.5 V, respectively, which can correspond to the overlapping of several redox processes involving Co and Mn species.
54 However, the peak currents decreased as the number of cycles increased, and finally, they disappeared. This indicated an irreversible redox process on the CMO_L surface when applying a potential. Consequently, CMO_L transformed and/or degraded, resulting in the deterioration of CMO_L.
